intro: Ophiocaulon apiculatum, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a rare and unique plant species native to the southeastern United States. It is a type of orchid that thrives in rocky, acidic soils, often found in shaded, humid environments. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its roots are adapted to absorb nutrients from the rocky substrates it inhabits. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species and is protected in many areas.
